problem.markdown:
Consider water at a given pressure 'p' and dryness fraction x[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline]. It is heated at constant pressure. The dryness fraction at the new state is x[mathjaxinline]_2[/mathjaxinline]. Therefore, heat supplied to water in this process is given by _________
( ) (x[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline] - x[mathjaxinline]_2[/mathjaxinline])*h[mathjaxinline]_{fg}[/mathjaxinline] (x) (x[mathjaxinline]_2[/mathjaxinline]- x[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline])*h[mathjaxinline]_{fg}[/mathjaxinline] ( ) (x[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline]+ x[mathjaxinline]_2[/mathjaxinline])*h[mathjaxinline]_{fg}[/mathjaxinline]
problem.p: Consider water at a given pressure 'p' and dryness fraction x[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline]. It is heated at constant pressure. The dryness fraction at the new state is x[mathjaxinline]_2[/mathjaxinline]. Therefore, heat supplied to water in this process is given by _________
